journal_entries.entry: The station is eerily quiet. I can hear the faint hum of the generators, but it feels like something is watching us. The deeper we go, the more I feel the weight of the ocean pressing down on us. I must document everything.

We found a strange coral formation today. It glows with an unnatural light. Dr. Elson seems obsessed with it, claiming it might be a sign of something greater. I can't shake the feeling that we are not alone here.
Captain Nash has been acting strangely. He talks to himself and jumps at shadows. I overheard him mention 'The Awakening.' What does that even mean? I need to keep an eye on him.

The whispers have started. I thought it was just my imagination, but others have heard them too. They seem to come from the depths of the trench. We must be cautious; the ocean holds secrets we are not meant to uncover.

I found an old waterproof journal belonging to a previous researcher. It details their descent into madness. I can’t help but feel that we are following in their footsteps. I must keep writing, keep documenting.
Something is wrong with the coral sample. It’s changing shape, almost as if it’s alive. I fear what we might awaken if we continue our research. The ocean is a dark and dangerous place.

I had a vision of Dr. Elson. She was warning me about the tide. I don’t know if it was real or just a hallucination, but I can’t shake the feeling that she is trying to communicate something important.
The flare gun is our last resort. If things go south, we need to be able to signal for help. But I worry that it will only attract more danger. The ocean is unforgiving.
I can feel the madness creeping in. The whispers are louder, and I can’t tell what’s real anymore. I must hold onto my sanity. I must keep writing.
